page.title: 05 CHINA CLAY.
page.content: China clay is the most important mineral mined in S.W.England.Open cast mines at St.Austel,Cornwall, and Lee Moor,Devon are the main producers and are owned by English Cina Clays. China clay is mined at Lee Moor using high pressure water hoses and after a series of refining processes it is piped to the Marsh Mills drying plant.The slurry is piped into cloth filters and squashed in a press and all the water gets sqeezed out.Then the China Clay is separated from the cloth.Then it gets put on a conveyor belt and taken to some large kilns where it is completely dried.Then it is stored as a powder or put into bags. Some goes by lorry and then by ship to other countries.Some goes by train to factories.
